item.title: Gui
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

I redesigned the GUI in Swing… SWT ended up being incredibly inconvenient, with its infinite loop and all.
Swing is working perfectly, I haven’t run into any problems that I haven’t been able to fix. I did have to switch GUI builders however, WindowBuilder seems to be extremely slow with resizing Swing components.

Read full topic

item.title: Gui
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:2, topic:437783”]getWindow().addText(s)

what.

use: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/javax/swing/JTextField.html[/quote]

Follow the methods, you’d see what I was doing (it ended up being far more complex than necessary).
WindowBuilder in Eclipse is incredibly confusing when mixing SWT and Swing components, is there an alternative?

item.title: Gui
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Hey guys, I seem to be having trouble with converting my modification of a console game to a game with at least a simple GUI.
The imminent error:

[code]
public Window getWindow(){
return window;
}

public void sM(String s)
{
    getWindow().addText(s);
}[/code]

I cannot add any text to the text field.
I’m using SWT, if that helps.

Window
http://pastebin.com/RcsAth2D

Game
http://pastebin.com/cZe08gnV
